<br>
Motor vehicle thefts so far this year are trending <h8>`r ifelse(autothefts_city$yeartodate_pct_change>=0," up"," down")` `r ifelse(autothefts_city$yeartodate_pct_change>=0,autothefts_city$yeartodate_pct_change,substring(autothefts_city$yeartodate_pct_change,2))`%</h8> compared to the same time period in 2021.

However, the auto theft rate over the last 12 months is<h8>`r ifelse((autothefts_city$last12mos-autothefts_city$avg_prior3years)>=0," up"," down")`</h8> compared to the annual average over the last three years, and the frequency of vehicles being reported stolen remains higher than it was before the pandemic.

The city is averaging <h8>`r round(autothefts_city$last12mos/52,0)`</h8> stolen vehicles a week over the last 12 months. In 2019, that number was <h8>`r round(autothefts_city$total19/52,0)`</h8> a week.

The risk is not the same neighborhood to neighborhood.

ABC7's data team looked at the New York Police Department's data by neighborhood from 2019 through `r format((Sys.Date() - 4), "%B %d")`.

<subhead>A closer look at vehicle thefts by neighborhood</subhead>

The map color-codes each neighborhood by the auto theft rate over the last 12 months. Darker blue areas are neighborhoods where the rate is higher than the citywide rate.

You can click any neighborhood to see detailed numbers or the buttons at the bottom of the map to switch between numbers and rates. You can search for a street, place, landmark or zip code to zoom to that location.

<br>
```{r cars, echo=FALSE,out.width='100%',out.height='800'}
# AUTO THEFTS MAP

# Set bins for numbers of crimes for auto thefts map
autotheftsbins1 <- c(0,
                50,
                100,
                150,
                250,
                500)
autotheftsbins2 <- c(0,
                50,
                100,
                150,
                300,
                450)
autotheftspal1 <- colorBin(c("#99a0a5",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), autothefts_beat$rate_last12, bins = autotheftsbins1,na.color = "#51585f")

autotheftspal2 <- colorBin(c("#99a0a5",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), autothefts_beat$last12mos, bins = autotheftsbins2,na.color = "#51585f")

                            
# Create labels for auto thefts map
autotheftslabel <- paste(sep="",
                     "<popuptitle>",
                     autothefts_beat$yeartodate2022,
                     ifelse(autothefts_beat$yeartodate2022==1,
                            " vehicle theft", " vehicle thefts"),
                     "</popuptitle><br>so far this year in <b>Precinct ",
                     autothefts_beat$precinct,
                     "</b>, home to about ",
                     prettyNum(autothefts_beat$population, big.mark=","),
                     " people. That's ",
                     case_when(autothefts_beat$yeartodate2022>
                              autothefts_beat$yeartodate2021 ~ "up from ",
                     autothefts_beat$yeartodate2022<
                              autothefts_beat$yeartodate2021 ~ "down from ",
                     TRUE ~ "the same as the "),
                     autothefts_beat$yeartodate2021,
                     " at this point in 2021. Here's are the numbers and rates per 100K residents for the last 12 months vs. three prior years.
<br>

# Creating police beats map for types of crimes
newyork_autothefts_map <- leaflet(autothefts_beat, options = leafletOptions(zoomControl = FALSE, zoomSnap = 0.5, zoomDelta=0.5)) %>%
  htmlwidgets::onRender("function(el, x) {
L.control.zoom({ position: 'topright' }).addTo(this)
}") %>%
  setView(-73.9, 40.75, zoom = 11) %>% 
  addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.Positron") %>%
  addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = autotheftslabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~autotheftspal1(rate_last12),
              group="Rate") %>% 
    addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = autotheftslabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~autotheftspal2(last12mos),
              group="Number") %>% 
  addSearchOSM(options = searchOptions(autoCollapse=FALSE, minLength = 3,zoom=13, position="topleft")) %>%
    onRender("function(el, x) {
        $('input.search-input')[0].placeholder = 'Search street, place or zip code'
        }") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = autothefts_beat$rate_last12, 
            pal = autotheftspal1,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Auto Thefts Rate<br><popupchatter>Auto Thefts/100K people<br>Citywide: ",autothefts_city$rate_last12),
            group = "Rate",
            className = "info legend Rate") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = autothefts_beat$last12mos, 
            pal = autotheftspal2,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Auto Thefts<br><popupchatter>Total Citywide: ",autothefts_city$last12mos),
            group = "Number",
            className = "info legend Number") %>%
  addLayersControl(
    baseGroups = c("Rate","Number"),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE),
    position = 'bottomright') %>% hideGroup(c("Number")) %>%
   htmlwidgets::onRender("
      function(el, x) {
         var updateLegend = function () {
            var selectedGroup = document.querySelectorAll('input:checked')[0].nextSibling.innerText.substr(1);

            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(a => a.hidden=true);
            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(l => {
               if (l.classList.contains(selectedGroup)) l.hidden=false;
            });
         };
         updateLegend();
         this.on('baselayerchange', el => updateLegend());
      }"
   )
newyork_autothefts_map
```
